javaslang

Interface λ<R>

  • Type Parameters:
    R - Return type of the function.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CheckedFunction0<R>, CheckedFunction1<T1,R>, CheckedFunction2<T1,T2,R>, CheckedFunction3<T1,T2,T3,R>, CheckedFunction4<T1,T2,T3,T4,R>, CheckedFunction5<T1,T2,T3,T4,T5,R>, CheckedFunction6<T1,T2,T3,T4,T5,T6,R>, Function0<R>, Function1<T1,R>, Function2<T1,T2,R>, Function3<T1,T2,T3,R>, Function4<T1,T2,T3,T4,R>, Function5<T1,T2,T3,T4,T5,R>, Function6<T1,T2,T3,T4,T5,T6,R>

    public interface λ<R>
extends Serializable

    This is a general definition of a (checked/unchecked) function of unknown parameters and a return type R. Lambda extends Serializable in order to be able to get runtime type information via getLambdaSignature(java.io.Serializable) and getSerializedLambda(java.io.Serializable).

    A checked function may throw an exception. The exception type cannot be expressed as a generic type parameter because Java cannot calculate type bounds on function composition.

    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Method Detail

      • getSerializedLambda

        static SerializedLambda getSerializedLambda(Serializable lambda)
        Serializes a lambda and returns the corresponding SerializedLambda.
        Parameters:
        lambda - A serializable lambda
        Returns:
        The serialized lambda wrapped in a Success, or a Failure if an exception occurred.
        See Also:
        printing debug info on errors with java 8 lambda expressions, Method Handles in Java

      • getLambdaSignature

        static MethodType getLambdaSignature(Serializable lambda)

        Gets the runtime method signature of the given lambda instance. Especially this function is handy when the functional interface is generic and the parameter and/or return types cannot be determined directly.

        Uses internally the SerializedLambda.getImplMethodSignature() by parsing the JVM field types of the method signature. The result is a MethodType which contains the return type and the parameter types of the given lambda.

        Parameters:
        lambda - A serializable lambda.
        Returns:
        The signature of the lambda as MethodType.

      • reversed

        λ<R> reversed()
        Returns a reversed version of this function. This may be useful in a recursive context.
        Returns:
        A reversed function equivalent to this.
